location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Sculpture, supposed by missionaries to be emblematic of Daniel in the Lion's den. (The German savants scout this theory.)' Photographer: Wilfrid Malleson

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:144 x 187 mmCondition:The print is in good condition with minor surface dirt throughout.Foliation:‘46’

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject MatterView in the ruins of Babylon (near Al Hillah) showing a statue of a stylised stone lion standing over the body of a man, supposed by missionaries to represent Daniel in the Lion’s den.InscriptionsInk, below image: 'Sculpture, supposed by missionaries to be emblematic of Daniel in the Lion's den. (The German savants scout this theory.)'
